isis.stitle: GAUGES AND WARNING LIGHTS - OPERATION - FUEL LEVEL GAUGE, LIGHT, AND ALARM

svcproc.title: FUEL LEVEL GAUGE, LIGHT, AND ALARM

svcprocinfo.para: The input signal to the Speedo/Tach module for the fuel level gauge (and warning light and alarm) comes from the fuel gauge sender.

svcsubproc.title: Fuel Gauge Sender
svcsubproc.para: The fuel gauge sender, located in the fuel tank, receives 12 volts from the Speedo/Tach module on circuit 36. The gauge sender is grounded through circuit 36-G to the J4 cab ground. The gauge acts like a variable resistor. When the fuel level is high, resistance is high and when the fuel level is low, resistance is low. This change in resistance creates the signal for the Speedo/Tach module.

svcsubproc.title: Fuel Level Gauge
svcsubproc.para: The Speedo/Tach module processes the signal from the sender and outputs signals to drive the gauge through connector (422) on circuits 36S(+), 36S(-), 36C(+) and 36C(-) to the right gauge cluster at connector (420). The fuel level gauge is a 4-pin electronically driven gauge that plugs into the gauge cluster.

svcsubproc.title: Warning Light
svcsubproc.para: The fuel level warning light should turn ON and remain on as a bulb test, while the gauges go through the self test process with key ON and engine OFF.

The low fuel warning light in the right gauge cluster receives ignition voltage (key ON) through cluster connector (420) from 10A fuse F4-A. The warning light ground path is through cluster connector (420) on circuit 36L to the Speedo/Tach module connector (421). In response to a fuel gauge sender input indicating the fuel level is less than 1/8 full, the module closes a ground switch causing the light to turn ON. The light remains ON as long as the fuel level is less than 1/8 of the tank.

svcsubproc.title: Alarm
svcsubproc.para: In response to sensor or ECM inputs indicating that fuel level is less than 1/8 capacity, the Speedo/Tach module causes the alarm to sound. The alarm will sound five short beeps when the low fuel light turns ON. The alarm is an internal feature of the Speedo/Tach module.

svcsubproc.title: Alarm And Warning Light Trip Points
svcsubproc.para: The Speedo/Tach module is programmed to report low fuel (warning light and alarm). This trip point may be changed or turned OFF using the Pro-Link 9000 electronic service tool.
